intro: Chorizanthe humilis, commonly known as the low larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, dry fruits called capsules. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Chorizanthe humilis is part of the Amaranthaceae family and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
